messages.title: Your Vote Will Decide the Future of This Country
messages.content: A personal message to voters in Southend West from David Amess. There has never been a general election in our lifetime as important as this one... Regardless of how you voted in the referendum, the choice in this election is stark... The main opposition party, who would undoubtedly be supported by the smaller parties, has a manifesto that would compromise our standing in the world and contains a number of uncosted, fantastical policies... A brighter future for our community, country, and children... Let’s get Brexit done.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Prime Minister’s Brexit deal will take the whole UK out of the European Union, ending the uncertainty and turmoil.
There will be no increase in income tax, National Insurance or VAT for families with children, or on keeping pensions high.
Support for businesses to grow, prosper, and create jobs through Business Rates reforms and improved infrastructure.
Increase the number of nurses, invest in new hospitals, and expand GP services and community hospitals.
Tackle crime and bring violent crime under control by recruiting 20,000 new police officers.
Enforce environmental laws and tackle issues like plastic waste and pollution.
Ensure every child has access to a good school with improved funding for education and better resources.
The pension triple lock will be maintained, and free TV licenses for over 75s will be preserved.

issues.brexitEurope: The Prime Minister’s Brexit deal will take the whole UK out of the European Union, ending the uncertainty and turmoil. Let's get Brexit done.
issues.education: Ensure every child has access to a good school. Improved funding for education and better resources.
issues.environment: Enforce environmental laws and tackle issues like plastic waste and pollution.
issues.health: Increase the number of nurses, invest in new hospitals, and expand GP services and community hospitals.
issues.immigration: Introduce an Australian-style points-based immigration system, raise standards in immigrant workers’ rights.
issues.labourEmployment: Support for businesses to grow, prosper, and create jobs through Business Rates reforms and improved infrastructure.
issues.lawCrime: Recruit 20,000 new police officers to tackle crime and bring violent crime under control.
issues.socialWelfare: No increase in income tax, National Insurance or VAT for families with children, or on keeping pensions high. The pension triple lock will be maintained, and free TV licenses for over 75s will be preserved.

community.content: David Amess has worked to improve local facilities such as bus routes, healthcare, and housing.

politicalExperience.achievements: Improving local NHS services, supporting local businesses, enhancing public transport.
